result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony R Crump was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges.

supervisions.notes: Straight time (without work release).  Sentence credit for 15 days were granted.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $672.64 to be paid to North Face, Joint and Several, to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs/surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

No contact with Co-defendant or Brookfield Square.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Take a Criminal Thinking Course.
Defendant pay surcharge.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber, non-working hours with standard re;ease conditions, STAYED, for use at Agent's discretion.

Prior: Waukesha County Jail,
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Anthony R Crump in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed in Court.  Defendant pleads guilty to the amended charge #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of the amended count #1.  State makes recommendations. Attorney Wolff makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
10 months Jail without work release.  (Credit - 15 days).  
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Take a Criminal Thinking Course;
Maintain/Obtain Part time employment;
No contact with Co-defendant or Brookfield Square.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge
Condition Time: 30 days Huber, NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
Restitution: $672.64 to be paid to North Face, Joint and Several to be paid as a condition of probation.  
COSTS:  $253.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
